titles: AI-Driven Financial Literacy and Nudging for MSMEs

Relevant AI Technologies: â€¢ MSMEs Financial Builder: An AI tool to nudge MSMEs to submit information or take actions to improve their "trust profile".
Expected Outcomes / Success Metrics: â€¢ Live Adaptive Learning: Interactive, scenario-based workshops and educational content that adapts to user maturity and recommends relevant products.
Current Solutions: â€¢ Gamification Engine: A gamified app experience to nudge behavior, allowing high-level users to access preferential rates or exclusive financing.
Target Users / Teams Impacted: Education for MSMEs is currently delivered through broad-base content creation that does not cater to the specific stages of different MSMEs. Content is typically distributed via social media, websites, or banking staff.
Data Availability & Readiness: The SME Banking Team, by enriching their content offerings to potential clients and improving product adoption.
Integration, Deployment, and Infrastruct: The bank possesses a large amount of structured content on its website and other platforms, as well as unstructured content in video formats, flyers, pamphlets, and product disclosure forms.
Preferred Collaboration Timeline: The solution should be on-premise, with the bank owning the IP. The company is open to a white-labeling or SaaS model. The MVP's focus is on the viability of the engine rather than the content itself.

Project Details: NeuroLeapâ€“PanAsia Hub was founded to address urgent challenges in central nervous system (CNS) drug development, especially in Asia, with the following key points:
Problem Statement: â€¢ Rising disease burden in Asia: Stroke, Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) are becoming urgent public-health challenges, surpassing cancer. The economic impact is equally stark: stroke alone consumed US $330 billion in direct health-care outlays in 2019, most of it borne by Asian nations.
Relevant AI Technologies: â€¢ High failure rates and long development times: Only 6â€“8 % of CNS drug candidates reach the market, and the approval timeline lasts 10-15 years, and the early compound-optimisation (hit-to-lead) stage takes 6â€“9 months.
Expected Outcomes / Success Metrics: â€¢ High cost to invest a CNS drug: Each approved CNS drug can cost USD 2â€“4 billion, and budgets for IND submissions in the US are USD 5-10 million.
Current Solutions: If no region-specific R&D solutions are implemented, CNS treatment costs will surpass cancer spending before 2035.
Target Users / Teams Impacted: Why Now: AI is unlocking a new era of faster, cheaper drug discovery. Breakthroughs from players like Insilico Medicine and Google DeepMind (AlphaFold) have proven that AI can cut years off timelines and reduce costs dramatically. Leveraging this same AI advantage, NeuroLeap-PanAsia Hub focuses on CNS disorders, especially PD and stroke, two diseases that significantly affect the Asia economy.
Data Availability & Readiness: Predictive Analytics / Forecasting, Generative AI (text, image, video, code generation), Search & Knowledge Retrieval
Integration, Deployment, and Infrastruct: By combining in silico, in vitro, and in vivo workflows in cost-efficient, government-supported labs in Southeast Asia, the NeuroLeap-PanAsia Hub aims to deliver CNS drug candidates up to 5Ã— faster and at 1/5th the cost of traditional pipelines.
Preferred Collaboration Timeline: (1) Accelerate drug development:
Tags: â€¢ Shorten the hit-to-lead cycle to â‰¤ 30 days (a 6â€“9Ã— speed-up vs. the industry average) by Month 18.

Certificate of Analysis Automation: We receive Ceritificate of Analysis (COA) on a daily basis for all raw materials we receive from suppliers both locally and internationally. These COAs comes in various formats, benchmark results criteria and layout - they're vital in quality assurance process to ensure raw materials meet international standards and internal control criteria before acceptance is performed.
Problem Statement: Currently, these documents are either received via email or physical copies and are analysed by QA team manually to detect out of specifications and anomalies for quality rejection process. This is painstakingly difficult due to the vast amount of lab COA formats and benchmark results for a large portoflio of raw materials from commodities like flour to small batches of flavouring additives.
Relevant AI Technologies: Generative AI (text, image, video, code generation), Predictive Analytics / Forecasting, Document Intelligence (data extraction from PDFs, forms, contracts), Computer Vision (image/video recognition, OCR)
Expected Outcomes / Success Metrics: Fully automate incoming COA reading via OCR with AI capabilities to detect anomaly by learning benchmark results of each raw material groups or test results category. With these data, to also predict non-conformace rate or performance of a supplier based on historical trend and propose next steps for QA team to act on. Example: if Supplier A always fails on Microbes test, to automatically focus on this test result for next incoming COA.
Current Solutions: Currently entire workflow is done manually without any system in place. SAP comes at the tail end for usage decision and stock release only.
Target Users / Teams Impacted: Quality assurance team, incoming warehouse receiving team, R&D team
Data Availability & Readiness: Unstructured COAs in PDFs, emails, and hardcopies occasionally for imported raw materials.
Preferred Collaboration Timeline: Submit your proposal for this use case and compete for theTBDreward.

titles: Integrated Store Communication & Compliance Checklist â€” Digitised Store Ops & Compliance
Integrated Store Communication & Complia: Other: NLP for checklist ingestion and automated classification/routing. Conversational UI and guided mobile workflows for store teams. Computer vision for photo-based evidence validation (e.g., hygiene or display issues). Predictive analytics to identify stores at risk of failing audits or where compliance correlates with lower sales. Anomaly detection for unusual checklist patterns or recurring issues.
Problem Statement: Secure, HQ-controlled communication (replaces WhatsApp) Target: Pilot â‰¥ 80% ops/escalations handled in the platform (not WhatsApp), 100% staff sign in with company email/SSO, leavers removed â‰¤ 24h, 0 non-employee members â†’ Scale â‰¥ 95% in-platform, resigned staff removed â‰¤ 4h, 0 non-employee members.
Relevant AI Technologies: On-time work with proper evidence Target: Pilot â‰¥ 95% tasks done on time & â‰¥ 90% cases with photo, time, and location â†’ Scale â‰¥ 98%
Expected Outcomes / Success Metrics: Fast handling and closure of issues Target: Pilot â‰¥ 90% issues assigned â‰¤ 15 min & â‰¥ 85% closed within agreed time: time to fix âˆ’35% â†’ Scale â‰¥ 95% assigned â‰¤ 10 min & â‰¥ 95% within agreed time; time to fix âˆ’60%.
Current Solutions: Clear link to sales and fewer sales disruptions Target: Pilot compliance-to-sales dashboard live by Week 2 & days of sales affected by critical issues âˆ’40% â†’ Scale 100% stores linked (weekly refresh) & âˆ’70%.
Target Users / Teams Impacted: Better fixes, fewer repeats Target: Pilot first-time fix â‰¥ 75% & repeat issues âˆ’30% â†’ Scale first-time fix â‰¥ 85% & âˆ’50%.
Data Availability & Readiness: Store issues are reported via WhatsApp, paper forms, and spreadsheets, leading to uncontrolled access, message loss, and poor traceability. Ownership is often unclear, with no standardized follow-up to ensure timely closure. Evidence (photos, timestamps, locations) is inconsistently captured and not reliably linked to cases. Management lacks a consolidated, real-time view across stores, and fragmented data cannot be correlated with sales, food safety audit (SQC) or customer experience. The result is slow resolution, elevated store SQC risk, and the absence of a single, controlled, auditable process to capture, assign, track, and close issues.
Integration, Deployment, and Infrastruct: Store teams & shift managers (primary users) QA / Food safety auditors Operations & regional managers (dashboards & escalations) Customer experience / CRM & sales teams (performance correlation) Maintenance & facilities teams (task assignment)
